intro: Epilobium × josefi-holubii, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves that are oval to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
